1.str2: From kata and a derivative of anti; to meet against, i.e. Arrive at.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of foreign origin; Derbe, a place in Asia Minor.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

1.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From Hellas; a Hellen or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

2.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lystra, a place in Asia Minor.
Perhaps from eikon; image-like; Iconium, a place in Asia Minor.

2.str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
